Search Food Trucks and Movie Night Comedy Night Bark and Brew Oktoberfest National Night Out Water Conservation Expo Home Residents City Special Events Comedy Night Comedy Night June Comedy Night PURCHASE TICKETS HERE Entertaining audiences for 30 years, Dave Johnson's high-energy magic and comedy leave the audience roaring with laughter and smiling from the wonder that he instills in them. Dave is always coming up with new routines so he can walk up to a group of people and “grab” them by their sense of reality and sense of humor and shake them into not knowing what is real. Dave has won many awards, including Magician of the Year for Best in Business' Las Vegas Region and Voted the Top Stand-up MagicianS in California. He is also a member the International Brotherhood of Magicians and the Academy of Magical Arts (The Magic Castle). This show is held inside The Oviedo Cultural Center at beautiful Center Lake Park. Doors will open at 7 pm with bar service. Hilarity ensues at approximately 8 pm. BY REQUEST, WE ARE OPENING THE DOORS AT 6PM. CASH/CC BAR AVAILABLE STARTING AT 6 PM. FOOD IS NOT AVAILABLE, so please plan accordingly. One of our sponsors is The Crazy Cork Wine Bar. They open at 4 pm and you can grab some delicious wine and dinner before or after the show! Tickets are $20 each during Early Bird until they sell out, and $25 after. Don't delay - secure your spot today! We do expect to sell out. ALL OF THESE SHOWS ARE 21+. There is adult language, content, themes, etc. Cash bar on site for your convenience & enjoyment. 21+. Drink responsibly. Before of after the show feel free to enjoy the rest of beautiful Center Lake Park. There are three large lawn spaces, a dog park, a spectacular Veterans Tribute, splash pad and playground, and the Cantina concession stand. There is a little something for everyone at Center Lake Park! Of course, there are great new restaurants and bars within walking distance in the Oviedo on the Park area as well. Plan to arrive early to secure your seats. There are also high top tables around the back as optional viewing areas as well. The room is typically on the cool side so you may want to bring a layer if you tend to run cold. Free parking. No smoking/vaping. No drink minimum. Several bars/restaurants in very close proximity to enjoy before and/or after the show. No need to travel to downtown Orlando or Sanford! Make sure to check out our other programs, events, amenities, and rental opportunities at Center Lake Park. Visit the City website at cityofoviedo.net or at OviedoRecNParks on Facebook and Twitter. For more information on upcoming events, call our event hotline at 407-971-5590. If you would like to sponsor one of these events, please contact Terri Martini at 407-971-5588. 									F Park map The Lake The Lake is one of Central Park’s most important scenic destinations. Location Mid-Park between 71st and 78th Restrooms No restrooms Share: Share on Twitter Share by Email Share on Facebook This 20-acre water body connects the Ramble , Bethesda Terrace , and various west side landscapes to form what is often called the heart of Central Park. In addition to wandering its varied shoreline and appreciating its many vistas, visitors can also explore the Lake by boat thanks to rowboat rentals available at the Central Park Boathouse . Central Park’s designers Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux envisioned the Lake as a key to fulfilling the Park’s primary purpose—providing a sense of wonder and escape from urban life. The Lake’s bridges and small structures, known as boat landings, are focal points, enticing visitors to explore further and enjoy the views. Then & Now: The Lake View with audio description The Lake was the first landscape in Central Park to be opened to the public in winter 1858. New Yorkers were drawn by the promise of ice skating, a recreational activity that was growing in popularity but not yet widely accessible. On Christmas morning that year, an estimated 8,000 people showed up to skate on the newly opened Lake. Boating was first made available in the 1860s and became widely popular. Quiet Moments at the Lake Enjoy this sunset view of the Lake, a gorgeous water body in the heart of Central Park. View with audio description The Central Park Conservancy completed a major four-year restoration of the Lake in 2010 to stabilize the shoreline, enhance the landscape with new plantings, rebuild infrastructure, and improve the overall ecological health of the area. Support the Park Help us care for the Park’s water bodies. The Conservancy’s work keeps them healthy and benefits the wildlife that depend on them. Inscríbase en Community Forester Community Tree Adoptions Preguntas-frecuentes FAQ for CLG Tree Adoption Community Connectors Community Climate Ambassadors Irrigation Solutions Rainwater Harvesting Solutions City Water & Other Solutions Community Resources Be A Smart Ash Resources for Residents Pruning Project Information Community Greening Projects Get Involved Sign Up For Our Newsletter Volunteer with Us Learn Our Blog Ways to Give Ways to Give Donate Online Wednesday, September 10, 2025 Who We Are About Us About Us The Park People is a private 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization working with communities to plant trees and improve parks for a healthy, resilient future. We are passionate about our local parks, our city trees, and other shared community resources. We believe that healthy parks help grow healthy communities. We believe that our community forest not only makes our neighborhoods beautiful places to live, but provides critical functions to the health, well-being, and sustainability of urban life. And we believe that all Denver residents should have access to these critical urban resources. We work towards our mission by raising private funds for capital improvement projects of various sizes and through several ongoing programs: Denver Digs Trees , Community Forester , Mile High Tree Champions , TreeForce , and Park Legacy . We are Denver's oldest and primary city-wide park advocacy group and longest-standing tree organization. We have infused tens of millions of dollars into the city's public spaces, and we have planted more than 60,000 trees in Denver. Learn more about What We Do . Our History The Park People was created in 1969 by a small group of park enthusiasts who banded together to raise private funds to support Denver's extensive parks and recreation system. We are a separate entity from Denver's Department of Parks and Recreation, but have worked in close partnership with the department since our founding. In our 50+-year history, The Park People has infused many millions of dollars into Denver's parks through the restoration of existing park infrastructure, such as fountains and historic park buildings, and through new construction, such as playgrounds and recreation facilities. Our projects include sites in Denver's highest profile parks like the Washington Park Boat House, Cheesman Park Pavilion, Civic Center Esplanade, and City Park fountains. We also value the city's lesser known community treasures, such as the beloved Sundial & Plaza in Cranmer Park, the historic James Fleming House in Platt Park, and the award-winning Gates Tennis Center in Cherry Creek. And we look for high-need projects, such as playground builds in neighborhoods that lack access to recreation resources. Learn about our Capital Projects . The Park People is best known as the home of Denver Digs Trees , a beloved, city-wide tree distribution program founded in 1991. The program's roots grow from the initiative of a small group of neighbors in West Wash Park who organized around kitchen tables to bring affordable trees to plant throughout their neighborhood in the 1980's. These scrappy neighbors distributed 50 trees out of residents' garages their first year. Their initiative expanded in scope and was adopted by The Park People in response to a city-wide need for affordable trees. Denver Digs Trees has since become a cherished community tradition, known throughout the city as a provider of carefully selected tree species appropriate for our arid climate and urban environment. We are proud to provide affordable trees to residents in all of Denver's neighborhoods and place particular emphasis on distributing trees in under-canopied neighborhoods. Since 1991, Denver Digs Trees has distributed more than 60,000 trees to Denver residents. Learn more about Denver Digs Trees and our other urban forestry programs . Support for The Park People comes from individual donations, program fees, foundation and government grants, and corporate sponsorships. The Park People is managed and executed by a small staff, a dedicated Board of Trustees, and many hundreds of volunteers each year. Find out how you can Get Involved and how you can Contribute . Search Accessibility Fee Schedule Recreation & Parks FAQs RecTrac & WebTrac Information Recreation Facility Hours Weather Updates Home City Departments Recreation & Parks Amphitheatre & Cultural Center Rental Information Amphitheatre & Cultural Center Rental Information Welcome to the Center Lake Park Amphitheatre and Cultural Center, the premier destination in the City’s newly redeveloped Oviedo on the Park area. Conveniently located at 357 Center Lake Lane, this stunning venue offers the perfect setting for weddings, receptions, banquets, parties, retreats, and performances. The Cultural Center features a spacious ballroom, a grand Amphitheatre, an outdoor patio, and breathtaking views of Center Lake, creating an unforgettable backdrop for any event. For more information about the Center Lake Park Cultural Center, call 407-971-5591 or 407-971-5585. Email events@cityofoviedo.net Catering and Food Alcoholic Beverage Policy Plans to serve alcohol at your event must be expressed when completing the rental agreement. All alcoholic beverages must be served via your selected caterer. For self-catered events, alcoholic beverages must be served via a licensed and insured bartender.   The bartender must follow the catering insurance guidelines. (see below for coverage limits). Proof of insurance is required a minimum of 14 days prior to the event date.  If proof of insurance is not provided, prior to the event date, the event is subject to the cancellation policy and all funds may be forfeited. Catering All catered functions at the Cultural Center must use a licensed and insured food service provider . The food service provider must include the City of Oviedo, 400 Alexandria Blvd, Oviedo, FL 32765, as the additionally insured .  Proof of insurance is required a minimum of 14 days prior to the event date.  If proof of insurance is not provided, prior to the event date, the event is subject to the cancellation policy and all funds may be forfeited. Commercial General Liability - The Caterer shall secure, at its own expense, commercial general liability insurance including all insurance requirements to service and sell food in the State of Florida. This liability insurance is to be issued by a company or companies authorized to do business in the State of Florida, with coverage for bodily injury, property damage, and personal injury and the following minimum coverage limits: $1,000,000 Bodily Injury & Property Damage-each occu1Tence occurrence $1,000,000 Personal & Advertising Injury-each occurrence $2,000,000 General Aggregate $2,000,000 Products/Completed Operations Aggregates limit $5,000 Medical Payments $100,000 Fire Damage Legal Liability Workers’ Compensation - The Caterer shall secure, at its own expense, workers' compensation insurance in such amounts as is required by the State of Florida and shall secure any other kind of insurance that may be required by law in connection with the Caterer's provision of Catering Services. The Caterer shall provide the City with a certificate of insurance evidencing its workers' compensation insurance, and shall thereafter annually provide the City with a certificate of insurance demonstrating compliance with the workers' compensation insurance requirement. $500,000 Each Accident $500,000 Each Employee $500,000 Policy Limit for Disease Automobile Liability Insurance shall be maintained by the selected firm or individual with a combined single limit of not less than $500,000 Bodily Injury and Property Damage in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida, as to the Ownership, maintenance, and use of all owned, non-owned, leased or hired vehicles. Other Required Insurance Coverage where unusual operations are necessary to complete the work, such as Longshoremen and Harbor Workers' Exposures, use of aircraft or watercraft, use of explosives, and any high-risk circumstances. No aircraft, watercraft or explosives shall be used without the express advance written approval of the City. Self-Catered Events The City of Oviedo does allow for self-catered events and host “pot luck” style catering under the following conditions: The self-catered dishes must be brought in complete and fully prepared, as there is no availability for preparation in the City of Oviedo’s Cultural Center kitchen. The self-catered dishes must go from vehicle to the serving table. (The food dishes may be buffet style.) All self-catered food dishes that are heated by external flames must be manned at all times. If any fires, spills, or damages are caused by negligence, the rental party will forfeit all deposits. If any fires, spills, or damages are caused by negligence that exceeds the deposit amount, the rental party may be subject to an additional bill from the City of Oviedo Anyone cooking or handling food for the self-catered event must comply with the USDA’s food safety guidelines. (Guidelines are included in the rental agreement.) Forms and Gallery Please use these forms to book your next event: Amphitheatre and Cultural Center Rental Booklet FAQs- Amphitheatre and Cultural Center Rental Agreement Catering Services Application rental fees and reservations All rental fees are set and approved by city council.  Click the link below to see the latest fee schedule as of 10/01/2024 2024-2025 Amphitheatre and Cultural Center Fees (PDF) Rental Facility Policies Reservations are taken on a first come, first serve basis. A signed event contract and room deposit are required to secure your date. The rental party must pay the remaining balance referenced on the Rental Agreement contract no less than 60 days prior to the event date. In the case that your reservation is made within 45 days of the rental date, the deposit and total rental fee are due at the time of booking. Four-hour rentals, on a Friday, Saturday or Sunday, may only be booked up to 60 days prior to the event date. Use of rented facilities are for the time and dates indicated on the Facility Rental Agreement. If an event runs past contracted time, additional fees will be charged. The Amphitheatre and Cultural Center accepts bookings up to twelve months in advance. Bookings will be available on the first business day of the month for the following year’s rental. Courtesy holds may be accepted and held for a maximum of five business days, at which time the hold will expire without notice. Courtesy holds may be made in-person during a scheduled facility tour, or by telephone. No courtesy holds will be accepted on the first business day of the month when booking twelve months in advance. It is advised you do a test run before an event where you are planning on using A/V elements. Testing of A/V equipment is complimentary for one 30-minute session. Any additional time will incur a monetary fee. A completed floor plan must be submitted no less than 14 days before your event. Rental time must include all necessary setup and breakdown time. Cancellation policy ALL CANCELLATIONS MUST BE IN WRITING. ( events@cityofoviedo.net ) Prior to 60 days – Rental Fee Refund ( Deposit forfeiture ) 31-60 days before start of event – Rental Fee Credit, Credit must be used within 120 days of cancellation ( Deposit forfeiture, Rental Fee Credit forfeiture on the 121 st day ) 0-30 days before start of event – no refunds or credits for future events given Due to financial obligations incurred by the City of Oviedo, no refunds or credits will be issued on cancellation requests, that are made less than 30 days prior to the start of the event. Cancellations that are declared less than 30 days in advance, will result in the forfeiture of all payments made to The City of Oviedo, as liquidated damages.  Liquated damages include but are not exclusive to: the loss of the use of the facility and increased administration costs.  Date changes that are made less than 30 business days prior to the event are treated as cancellations and there will be no refunds or credits for future events given. Cancellations due to Acts of God will be considered on a case-by-case basis. The City of Oviedo reserves the right to cancel or reschedule the event due to unforeseen circumstances, and will refund fees if the event is rescheduled or location is changed. Make a Reservation Reserving a space at the Cultural Center is easy. Please contact us to check availability and discuss your upcoming event. Facility Rental Inquiry Form AV Testing Testing of AV equipment use is complimentary for one (1) 30-minute session; for additional time the renter will be charged $30.00 for 30 minutes. Testing must be scheduled at least ten (10) days prior to the scheduled event date with the Cultural Center staff. The renter is responsible for all cords and accessories. The Oviedo Cultural Center does not provide laptops, laptop cords, VGA cords, extension cords, etc. Facility Capacity No Dance Floor (banquet style)- 180 people With 16 x 16 Dance Floor (banquet style)- 160 people Theatre Style- 225 people Frequently Asked Questions City of Oviedo Amphitheatre and Cultural Center FAQs Frequently Asked Questions What does my rental include? Your rental includes the space as well as the use of our inventory listed below. Staff will set up and breakdown our included inventory as requested on a floor plan submitted by you. Banquet Chairs (245) Two-Tier Bar/Buffet (4) 6-foot Round Table (23) Sweetheart Table (4) 6-foot Rectangle Table (32) Televisions with A/V Hookup (7) High Top Cocktail Table (22) Podium- includes microphone (1) 36-inch Round Cake Table (1) Barstools (6) Metal Easel (4) Wood Easel (3) Serpentine Table (2) 36-inch Square Table (1) ¼ Circle Table (1) Console Table (1) Green Room Access (1) How far in advance can I book a rental? The Center Lake Park Amphitheatre and Cultural Center accepts bookings up to 12 months in advance. When making a reservation 12 months in advance, booking opens the first business day of the month. What is the process for reserving a rental space? All dates are first come, first serve. A signed contract and payment of the deposit will secure your date. How late can I stay? Your event must end and all guests must vacate the premises by the end of your contracted rental period. Additional time must be pre-arranged with the rental office. What if we’re having a great time and stay later than our rental period? The standard hourly rental rate for each area rented will be doubled and charged for any time you are in the building past your contracted rental period (no discounts apply). Events cannot go past midnight. Will I receive a refund if I leave early? There are no refunds for leaving your rental early. Please plan your event as accurately as possible. Can I choose my vendors? Caterers: See page 3 for all catering details. Other Vendors: You may choose your DJ, florist, photographer, etc. Each outside vendor will need to be additionally insured covering the City of Oviedo for 1 million dollars. Can I have items delivered by my caterer, florist, DJ, etc.? The facility will not be open before your scheduled rental time for deliveries. If the user has any other vendors needing to enter the facility beforeat  your scheduled rental, you must make 2024-2025 City of Oviedo Amphitheatre and Cultural Center FAQs arrangements with City staff and the selected vendor. Otherwise, all deliveries and setups must occur during the period of use. Can I come anytime to view the building, meet my caterer, meet with my florist, etc.? The building is available by appointment only. To set up an appointment, please call our office 407-971-5585 or 407-971-5591 or email events@cityofoviedo.net . Can I decorate the space? Decorations are permitted within reason and must be approved by Cultural Center management. Decorations are permitted only in the space you have reserved. It is the responsibility of the renter to remove all decorations immediately after your event.  No rice (including puffed rice or biodegradable rice), birdseed, confetti, glitter, or other similar materials may be used inside or outside the the Cultural Center. All balloons and/or arches must be taken away after event. Balloons are not to be deflated or popped inside the building. Flower petals are only permitted inside; however, they must be cleaned up by a member of the rental party. Battery-powered or solar powered candles only. Decorations may not be affixed to the walls, doors, windows, window coverings, chairs, painted surfaces, or hung from the ceiling. Fog machines, dry ice, and bubbles are permitted outside only. Can I bring alcoholic beverages? All alcoholic beverages must be served via your selected caterer. For self-catered events, alcoholic beverages must be served via a licensed and insured bartender.  The bartender must follow the catering insurance guidelines. (view coverage limits). Proof of insurance is required a minimum of 14 days before the event date.  If proof of insurance is not provided, prior to the event date, the event is subject to the cancellation policy and all funds may be forfeited. Plans to serve alcohol at your event must be expressed when completing the rental agreement. Can I host a Religious Service at the Cultural Center? No, The City of Oviedo’s policy states that the Cultural Center cannot be used for reoccurring church/religious services of any kind.  Religious ceremonies are approved case-by-case, dependent upon the scope of the ceremony. What is the facility’s smoking policy? By entering the Facility Rental Agreement, the Renter agrees that no smoking or the use of tobacco products, e-cigarettes, or vapes of any kind will occur in City facilities. 2024-2025 City of Oviedo Amphitheatre and Cultural Center Add-On’s Item Price Gifn (digital photo booth) with facility rental (add on) 150.00 Tablecloths (individual) (Black or White only) 10.00 per tablecloth White Ceremonial Chairs (up to 100) (rate is per chair) 1.50 per chair Basic Beverage Service (if available) (coffee & cups each) 5.00 each Full Beverage Service (if available) (coffee/tea/lemonade/juice/similar)(each) 10.00 each Beverage Dispensers 10.00 each Standard Coffee Urns 25.00 each Upgraded Coffee Urn 35.00 each Pot Belly Warmers 20.00 each Outdoor Picnic Tables 25.00 each A-Frame w/o insert 25.00 each Stanchions used on property 10.00 each Street cones (each) 2.00 each Outside lanterns (string lights or similar) - small (each) 5.00 each Outside lanterns (string lights or similar) - large (each) 10.00 each Dance floor 250.00 Gifn (digital photo booth) with facility rental (add on) 150.00 Public Notices Agendas & Minutes Employment City Special Events Building Permits Recreation Programs Contact Us City of Oviedo 400 Alexandria Blvd Oviedo, FL 32765 Phone: 407-971-5555 Quick Links Mayor & Council Upcoming Events Public Safety State of the City Title VI Non Discrimination Policy /QuickLinks.aspx FAQs Where and how do I register to vote? There are three planned events to celebrate the legacy of MLK Jr. that the entire community can enjoy. All events are free to the public. The schedule of events is as follows: Saturday, January 18, 2025 – 9 a.m. Community Prayer Breakfast with awards honoring the 2025 recipients of MLK, “I Have a Dream Award”. The location is at the Oviedo Cultural Center, 357 Center Lake Lane. Monday, January 20, 2025 – 10 a.m . – Celebratory parade with the Lake Mary Little League World Champions as the Grand Marshals. The parade starts at Oviedo High School and will end at Center Lake Park, 299 Center Lake Lane. Monday, January 20, 2025 – 11 a.m . – Fun Day at the Park, immediately following the parade. Media is welcome to attend any of the events listed above. Oviedo Police officers will be on-site for a free car seat check for any resident who wants to ensure their car seats are installed properly or needs help installing them. Nationally, four out of five car seats are used incorrectly or improperly installed.  According to HealthyChildren.org, not all car safety seats are the same.   The type of seat your child needs depends on several factors such as age, size and developmental needs. Officers will be working alongside Nationally Certified Child Passenger Safety Technicians to assist with properly installing car seats.  Any caregivers with kids needing a car seat installed are encouraged to come to the Oviedo Police Department between 3:30 p.m. and 5:30 p.m. for a check!  Officers and Safety Technicians will also demonstrate how to install safety seats that are brought.  No seats will be provided at this event. Cost: FREE to the public Media is invited to attend this event to speak with safety experts and parents.  Please contact Communications Manager Lisa McDonald at 689-710-4568 (call or text) or email lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net. ### FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: January 23, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net Oviedo Police to Host Car Seat Check-Up Event Oviedo, Fla. – The Oviedo Police Department will host a Car Seat Check-up Event on Wednesday, February 5, 2025. Cost: FREE to the public Media is invited to attend this event to speak with safety experts and parents.  Please contact Communications Manager Lisa McDonald at 689-710-4568 (call or text) or email lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net. ### 2-3 Opera in the Park FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: February 3, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City of Oviedo partners with Opera Orlando to Present Opera in the Park Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo, in partnership with Opera Orlando, invites you to an unforgettable, family-friendly presentation of Cinderella . This magical event, sponsored by the Oviedo Public Arts Board, is free to the public and sure to delight audiences of all ages. Join us on Saturday, February 15, 2025, at 11 a.m. at the Oviedo Amphitheatre and Cultural Center , located at 357 Center Lake Lane , for a performance filled with enchanting costumes, captivating music, and the timeless charm of this classic fairy tale. Bring a chair, blanket, snacks, or a picnic lunch, and enjoy this incredible show from the beautiful Center Lake Lawn . This event is the perfect opportunity to introduce children to the magic of opera while enjoying a morning of arts and culture in our community. Don’t miss out on this enchanting experience that will leave audiences spellbound! For more information, visit www.cityofoviedo.net. About Opera Orlando: Opera Orlando is dedicated to bringing high-quality performances and enriching cultural experiences to the Central Florida community. Through innovative productions and educational initiatives, they inspire audiences of all ages with the transformative power of music and storytelling. About the Oviedo Public Arts Board: The Oviedo Public Arts Board is committed to promoting the arts and enhancing the cultural fabric of the Oviedo community by supporting artistic initiatives and events that foster creativity and engagement. ### 2-6 City GFOA Budget Award FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: February 6, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City of Oviedo Finance Department Receives Distinguished Budget Presentation Award Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo is proud to announce that it has been awarded the Distinguished Budget Presentation Award by the Government Finance Officers Association (GFOA) for its annual budget document for the fiscal year beginning October 2024. This prestigious award is the highest form of recognition in governmental budgeting and represents a significant achievement in financial planning and transparency. A panel of independent reviewers conducted a thorough examination of the budget document and determined that it meets the highest standards of the GFOA’s Budget Award Program. In addition to receiving the award, Oviedo earned special recognition in the following key areas: Performance Measures Strategic Goals & Strategies Special recognition is granted when all three reviewers give the highest possible score in specific categories, further underscoring the excellence of our budget presentation. The Distinguished Budget Presentation Award is valid for one year, and Oviedo will continue its commitment to high-quality financial reporting by submitting future budget documents for evaluation. As part of the award package, our organization received detailed scores and comments from reviewers, a camera-ready version of the award for inclusion in the next budget document, and a Certificate of Recognition for the individuals or department primarily responsible for this achievement. "This award represents the 20 th consecutive year that the City has been recognized for this prestigious award,” said Finance Director, Jerry Boop. “We want to thank our City Council for their support and for providing the resources that allow us to achieve excellence for the City.” The Government Finance Officers Association (GFOA) is a nationally recognized organization dedicated to enhancing and promoting excellence in public finance. The Distinguished Budget Presentation Award is given to entities that meet rigorous program criteria, ensuring that budget documents serve as a policy document, financial plan, operations guide, and communications tool. 2-11 New Pedestrian Hybrid Beacon FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: February 11, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City of Oviedo and FDOT Activate New Pedestrian Hybrid Beacon at Oviedo High School Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo, in partnership with the Florida Department of Transportation (FDOT), is excited to announce the activation of a new Pedestrian Hybrid Beacon (PHB) in front of Oviedo High School. The beacon went live Tuesday, February 10, as part of ongoing improvements along the State Road 426/County Road 419 corridor. This innovative safety feature has been installed to provide a secure crossing option for pedestrians, particularly students, navigating this busy stretch of road during school hours and beyond. The Pedestrian Hybrid Beacon, designed and installed by FDOT, functions similarly to a traffic signal but remains inactive until a pedestrian activates it. This cutting-edge safety solution has already proven effective across Central Florida in helping pedestrians safely cross high-traffic areas. How It Works Activation : Pedestrians press a button on the roadside pole to activate the beacon. Flashing Yellow : The beacon begins with a flashing yellow light to alert drivers. Steady Yellow : The signal transitions to a steady yellow, indicating drivers should prepare to stop. Steady Red : The light turns solid red, requiring drivers to stop, while pedestrians see a WALK signal to cross safely. Flashing Red : After the WALK phase, the pedestrian signal switches to a flashing DON’T WALK . During this phase, drivers see alternating flashing red lights, signaling them to stop, yield to pedestrians, and proceed only when the crosswalk is clear. Media Availability FDOT and the City of Oviedo will have media availability on Wednesday, February 12 at 7:00 a.m. District 5 Safety Administrator Loreen Bobo and an officer from the Oviedo Police Department will be present to assist kids crossing to Oviedo High School and to demonstrate the beacon's operation and educate students on its use. This partnership highlights Oviedo’s and FDOT’s commitment to pedestrian safety and creating a safer community for all. ### 2-20 Relay for Life Golf Tournament FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: February 20, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City of Oviedo 16 th Annual Relay for Life Golf Tournament Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo’s annual Relay for Life Golf Tournament will tee off on Friday, February 21, 2025, at the Twin Rivers Golf Club to raise money for charity. The annual golf charity is sponsored by the City of Oviedo and Waste Pro, with the program being organized by the Recreation and Parks Department. The golf tournament raises money for Relay for Life, the American Cancer Society, Helpful Hands and the Veterans Tribute in Center Lake Park. This is the 16th year the City has held the golf tournament and golfers will tee off at 8:30 a.m.. The tournament is approximately four hours and holes are sponsored by various local businesses. Each player will receive a breakfast, full hot lunch, beverages, a full 18 holes of golf and a swag bag with vouchers, coupons and more.  Players will be provided with golf carts and power packs.  There is also an opportunity for silent and live auction bids for high-value items. The American Cancer Society and Relay for Life raise money to help find a cure for cancer, as well as, connect patients to programs and services.  Helpful Hands is a local, Oviedo-based charity that helps children in crisis and provides quality-of-life programs for children and families through athletics, camps, fine arts and holiday programs.  The Veterans Tribute honors active, retired and fallen soldiers with connections to Oviedo. Funds raised from the tournament will be presented to the American Cancer Society and Helpful Hands at a future City Council meeting. 3-5 St. Patrick's Day Celebration FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: March 3, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net Annual St. Patrick’s Day Celebration in Oviedo Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo is excited to host the St. Patrick’s Day Festival on Saturday, March 15, 2025, from 4 p.m. to 9 p.m. at Center Lake Park . This fun event will have live music on the Amphitheatre stage. You can watch performances by Colin Farrell and The Byrne Brothers , and see the Finnegan Irish Step Dancers between shows. Families can enjoy stilt walkers, face painting, a photo booth, and jugglers. Adults can try green beer. Local vendors and food trucks will be at Center Lake Lane , serving traditional Irish food. There will also be a beer tent with different kinds of beer. To buy beer, you must be 21 years or older and show your ID. You will need a punch card to get beer. Each card costs $25 for 4 punches and can be bought on Eventbrite.com or at the event. The event is FREE to attend. You can buy beer punch cards online to skip lines at the event. One punch on the card gets you a pint of beer. There will also be a bar with other drinks, but the punch cards can only be used for beer. Media is welcome to join and cover the event. For more information, please contact Lisa McDonald at lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net or text/call 689-710-4568 . Event Details: What: St. Patrick’s Day Festival When: Saturday, March 15, 2025 Time: 4 p.m. to 9 p.m. Where: Center Lake Park, 299 Center Lake Lane, Oviedo Cost: Free to attend. Beer punch cards are $25 on Eventbrite.com Come join the fun and celebrate St. Patrick’s Day with music, food, and great entertainment in Oviedo! 3-7 Firefighter pinning FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: March 7, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net Two New Firefighters Pinned in Oviedo Oviedo, Fla. – On Friday, March 7, 2025, two firefighters were sworn in and pinned at Oviedo City Hall. Firefighters Oliver Teal and Victor Velasquez III went through the orientation process before being assigned to their shifts following the ceremony. Teal and Velasquez both spent time working with Battalion Chiefs, Engineers, Paramedics, Lieutenants, and trainers on hose lines, hydrant work, rapid rescue, ladders, forcible entry, extrication, and Tower Truck/Aerial operations. “I am excited to welcome Firefighters Teal and Velasquez to the Oviedo Fire Department,” said Oviedo Fire Chief Michael Woodward. “Their enthusiasm and passion for the fire service will contribute to the great service we provide to the Citizens of Oviedo.” Fire Chief Michael Woodward officially swore in Teal and Velasquez. “Always remain humble and never stop learning,” said Fire Chief Michael Woodward during the ceremony. Velasquez is originally from Miami and came to Orlando about two years ago. He graduated from the Fire Academy in Orlando. Before becoming a firefighter, Velasquez served four years in the Coast Guard and is currently in the Army National Guard and recently returned from a deployment. Teal originally hails from a town just north of Manchester England and has been in the U.S. for approximately 13 years, with eight of those years in Florida.  He wanted to become a firefighter after living next door to a Polk County fire station. Along with friends and family, both firefighters were joined by Mayor Sladek and Councilmember Ott, City Manager Bryan Cobb, Fire Command Staff, Fire Department Staff, and city staff. 3-12 Fishing with a cop FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: March 12, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 Office 689-710-4568 Cell lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net Oviedo Police hosting ‘Fishing with a Cop’ Event for Kids Oviedo, Fla. – The Oviedo Police Department will host Fishing with a Cop on Saturday, March 15, 2025, at Long Lake Park in Oviedo. Police officers and Seminole County Deputies will be paired up with kids who want to come out and learn how to fish in Long Lake, which is a hot spot for fishing in the community. Kids can bring their fishing poles or borrow one that was generously donated to the police department from the Mud Hole, Carl Black Orlando and Bitter’s Bait and Tackle. “This annual event is a favorite in our community.  This event kicks off spring break for our kids,” said Oviedo Police Chief Dale Coleman.  “We want to provide the kids with a healthy outlet while interacting with law enforcement, allowing them to get to know our officers while teaching them a bit about how to fish.” Fishing with a Cop is a free event for the kids and is a great way to get the kids outdoors while teaching them skills. What: Water Safety Day When: Saturday, May 3, 2025 Time: 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Where: Oviedo Aquatics Center and Gym – 148 Oviedo Blvd. Oviedo Cost:  Free to the Public 5-20 Summer Heat Reminder FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: May 20, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net Summer Heat Reminder: Do Not Leave Kids/Pets in Hot Cars Oviedo, Fla. – The Oviedo Police and Fire Departments want to remind citizens to never leave children or pets inside of hot cars. As temperatures start to climb in Central Florida, Oviedo Public Safety officials want to remind all residents to never leave children or pets unattended in a vehicle, even if it is just for a few minutes. Every summer, tragic incidents occur when children or animals are left inside locked cars, where temperatures can rise dangerously fast, even with the windows cracked. In just 10 minutes, the temperature inside a vehicle can climb by 20 degrees. On a 90-degree day, that can mean deadly heat levels in less time than it takes to run a quick errand. Parents of small children and animal owners should always take the time to Stop, Look and Lock. Stop the car and make it a point to turn around, look, and make sure the back seat is clear. If at home, always lock the car to ensure children playing cannot get inside and accidentally lock themselves inside the vehicle. “School is ending and people’s routines may be changing,” said Oviedo Police Chief Dale Coleman. “It may be easier to forget the kids are in the car while running errands or going to work. We want to make sure everyone remains safe in the heat.” Some quick facts about heat: · Heatstroke is a leading cause of non-crash vehicle-related deaths in children. · A child’s body temperature rises three to five times faster than an adult’s. · Pets can suffer organ damage or death from heat exposure in a matter of minutes. “It’s imperative to call 9-1-1 if you see a child or pet in distress if they are in a locked vehicle,” said Oviedo Fire Chief Michael Woodward. “The faster a firefighter or police officer can get to the child/pet, the better chances they have to survive.” Anyone who sees a child or pet locked in a car without a parent or guardian in proximity can call 9-1-1 for help. It is a 2 nd degree felony in the State of Florida to leave a child under the age of 6 in a locked vehicle for longer than 15 minutes. ### 5-22 Memorial Day FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: May 22, 2024 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City Offices Closed to Observe Memorial Day Oviedo, Fla. – City of Oviedo government offices will be closed on Monday, May 26, 2025, to observe Memorial Day.   Offices will re-open on Tuesday, May 27, 2025 at 8 a.m. On Monday, May 26, 2025, there will be a sunset Memorial Day Ceremony at the Veterans Tribute, located at Center Lake Park (299 Center Lake Lane). The program, created by the Public Works Stormwater Division, was an initiative within the Community Rating System guided by FEMA (more on the program can be found under the stormwater web page). The city saw a way to combine the basic idea of outlining what habitats could potentially be within the floodplains and take it a step further and involve city residents and visitors to the local trails and parks by observing wildlife in its natural habitat. The program is interactive and provides the ability to send pictures of wildlife spotted and pinpoint locations to track the various species in the city. Wildlife Whereabouts is an exciting new citizen science initiative that encourages residents to explore the outdoors and contribute to wildlife conservation.  Citizens can use the online, interactive map to see not only what type of rare or endangered wildlife they could be viewing, but can also see more common species of local interest and where wildlife can be found. The city houses several bird species such as bald eagles, sandhill cranes and owls. In addition, other species such as otters, alligators, deer, snakes, turtles and many more are also part of the city’s ecosystem, along with valuable native plants that help the local wildlife thrive. The full list can be found here: cityofoviedo.net/1203/Stormwater Wildlife Whereabouts will be a fun summer activity for families that will educate them about species and their habitats. Residents can use the online form to fill out where they found the species on the map and upload their pictures with a photo credit displaying the photographer’s name.  The online form can be used on cellphones, laptops and desktops and can be found in the link listed above.  There is also a direct link on the City’s homepage in the “City News” section. “This is a fantastic opportunity to keep kids engaged over the summer while supporting environmental education and wildlife conservation,” said Floodplain Administrator Amanda Kortus. “We hope to inspire a greater appreciation for nature right here in our own backyards.” SAFETY FIRST Anyone wishing to participate and submit a form is asked to observe the rules and Florida State laws when it comes to wildlife. Keep a safe distance from all wildlife, especially dangerous species such as alligators, snakes and bears. Do not feed the wildlife to get a good picture. That is against the law. Keep children at a safe distance. Do not disturb nests or offspring. Observe, don’t interact. The city wants to inspire young biologists, nature lovers and photographers to explore and reconnect with nature through this ongoing program. ### Tab Name 6-5 Art in the Chambers FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: June 5, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City of Oviedo Opens Second “Art in the Chambers” Exhibition Featuring Local Artist Wonda Granville Oviedo, Fla. – In May, the Oviedo City Council and the Oviedo Public Arts Board proudly opened the second installment of the “ Art in the Chambers” exhibition, featuring a collection of charcoal drawings by local artist Wonda Granville. For press inquiries regarding the Art in the Chambers program, including photo or video requests, please contact Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager , at lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net or via text at 689-710-4568 to coordinate arrangements. ### 6-12 McKinnon Ribbon Cutting FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: June 12, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City of Oviedo to Hold Ribbon Cutting for the Reopening and Rebuilding of McKinnon Avenue/Ditch Oviedo, Fla. – City of Oviedo officials will host a ribbon-cutting ceremony to celebrate the reopening of McKinnon Avenue and the rebuild of McKinnon ditch in the Alafaya Woods subdivision, following extensive repairs from damage caused by Hurricane Ian in 2022. The McKinnon Ditch, located at the intersection of McKinnon Avenue and Gould Place, sustained severe damage during the hurricane. Erosion from floodwaters caused a collapse in the area, prompting City Engineers to implement interim repairs while developing a long-term solution. Working diligently with consultants and contractors, the Public Works Department developed a comprehensive plan not only to rebuild the collapsed portion of McKinnon Avenue but also to restore the eroded access road and install a new drainage system to improve water flow from a nearby ditch. The road was reconstructed with a reinforced box culvert designed to withstand higher floodwaters and better manage storm runoff. “We spent a significant amount of time redesigning this area in case another 100-year storm like Ian comes through,” said Assistant City Engineer Paul Yeargain. “The City and our residents are happy to see the end of this project and for Alafaya Woods to regain that sense of normalcy.” The area is now fully operational and open to both pedestrian and vehicular traffic. An official ribbon-cutting ceremony will take place on Friday, June 13, 2025, at 10 a.m. , to mark the completion of the project. Media are invited to attend. Interviews will be available at the site. Who: City of Oviedo officials, City Contractors, Alafaya Woods HOA Officers Please contact Communications Manager Lisa McDonald at lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net or text 689-710-4568 if you would like to attend. ### 6-18 Oviedo Independence Day Celebration FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: June 18, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City of Oviedo to Host Indoor Independence Day Celebration and Fireworks Show at Oviedo Mall Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo, in partnership with the Oviedo Mall, will host a family-friendly Independence Day celebration on Saturday, July 5, 2025 , featuring indoor entertainment and an outdoor fireworks display. The vehicle features eye-catching graphics centered around an otter theme—connecting directly to the City’s ongoing Wildlife Whereabouts initiative, which encourages residents to document sightings of native wildlife, including otters that inhabit local waterways like Sweetwater Creek, Live Oak Reserve, and the Little Econ River. “This vehicle used to be a familiar sight at city events as part of our stormwater education efforts,” said Stormwater and Floodplain Administrator Amanda Kortus. “The previous wrap had become worn, so we retired it temporarily. Now it’s back on the streets with a fun and fresh design, ready to help educate our community.” The Otter Box will once again serve as a mobile educational display at events promoting awareness about how stormwater systems work and why protecting local waterways is so important. The otter was chosen because they have been seen in Sweetwater Creek, Live Oak and the Little Econ River, making them the perfect, adorable mascot for stormwater. In addition, Public Works wants to promote the Wildlife Whereabouts programs, where residents and visitors can take pictures and report where they have seen local wildlife. Keep an eye out for the Otter Box around town—and remember, protecting our stormwater system helps protect our local wildlife. The City would like to thank Just Wraps for their great workmanship wrapping the Otter Box. ### 7-1 School Resource Officer of the Year FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: July 1, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net Oviedo Police Officer chosen as School Resource Officer of the Year Oviedo, Fla. – The Oviedo Police Department is proud to announce that Officer Ashley Pierce has been named the Florida School Resource Officer of the Year by the Florida Association of School Resource Officers (FASRO). The award was presented during FASRO’s annual conference held over the weekend in Miami. The Florida Attorney General/Florida Association of School Resource Officers SRO of the Year award is presented annually to a School Resource Officer who has made a significant contribution to their school and community. This award is to recognize an individual who has gone above and beyond their normal duties as an SRO and has shown dedication and a tireless work ethic to enhance the SRO philosophy of counselor, teacher, and law enforcement officer.  Each year the AG and FASRO partner to choose a victor. Officer Pierce, an 18-year veteran of the Oviedo Police Department, currently serves as the School Resource Officer (SRO) at Lawton Chiles Middle School. Her dedication to students extends far beyond her regular duties. She leads several impactful programs on campus, including the school’s food pantry to support families facing food insecurity, Panther Threads, a clothing donation closet for students, and a school supply drive at the start of each school year. Officer Pierce also organizes the school’s Angel Tree Program during the holidays, an annual Thanksgiving basket donation drive, and a holiday toy drive. She even coordinates a holiday store, where students can select gifts for their families, extending her support to other schools across the district as well. Officer Pierce is often accompanied by her comfort K9, Xander, a beloved presence at the school who provides emotional support and helps students manage stress and anxiety. Together, Officer Pierce and Xander foster a safe and nurturing school environment where students can thrive both emotionally and academically. “Officer Pierce is so passionate about her community and helping kids who need it the most,” said Oviedo Police Chief Dale Coleman. “She is a rock for the kids at the school and exemplifies everything a police officer should be in Oviedo.” The impact Officer Pierce has had on her school and the broader community cannot be overstated. Her ability to build meaningful, trusting relationships with students, staff, and families is at the core of her success. She creates a positive, supportive atmosphere that is essential for a strong learning environment. Pierce was selected from a pool of candidates across the state. The announcement was kept a surprise until the official presentation at the conference. Founded in 1979, the Florida Association of School Resource Officers provides comprehensive training and support for school-based law enforcement throughout the state. ### 7-2 City of Oviedo Call to Artists FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: July 2, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City of Oviedo Call to Artists for a Logo Design Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo Public Arts Board is excited to announce a Call to Artists for the creation of a logo to represent the Oviedo Arts and Entertainment District, a new initiative located within Oviedo on the Park. Oviedo on the Park serves as a hub for community events, festivals, and performances, and the new district aims to further enrich the city’s cultural and entertainment offerings. To support the vision, the Public Arts Board is seeking a distinctive logo design that reflects the spirit of community gathering, local culture, and the energy of downtown Oviedo. The selected logo will be prominently featured on white, reusable 16-ounce stadium cups—the designated open-container beverage cups approved for use within Oviedo on the Park. The logo will help identify participating vendors and provide a consistent visual identity for the Arts and Entertainment District. The artist chosen will receive a $1,000 stipend upon signing an agreement granting the City exclusive rights to the design. Artists must be 18 years old or older and reside in the State of Florida. Design Guidelines Aspect Ratio: Must be 1:1 or 3:2 (vertical). File Format: Initial submissions must be in SVG, PNG, or PDF. Final design will be required in vector format (EPS or SVG). Color: Designs must include both a full-color and a single-color version. Text Requirement: The logo must include the name "Oviedo Arts and Entertainment District." Application Requirements To be considered, artists must submit the following: A completed entry form (available on the City’s website) The proposed logo design (SVG, PNG, or PDF) A current résumé or CV A one-paragraph artist biography An artist statement describing the vision behind the logo A proposed project schedule How to Submit Anyone wishing to submit a design can head to www.cityofoviedo.net and fill out the form located under the City News Feed on the homepage. ### 7-9 New Officers Sworn In FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: July 9, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net New Oviedo Police Officers Sworn In and Pinned Oviedo, Fla. – The Oviedo Police Department officially welcomed two new officers to its ranks today as Christopher St. John and William Riddleberger were sworn in during a ceremony in the Oviedo City Council Chambers. Officers St. John and Riddleberger were sworn in and pinned at 10:30 a.m., with the oath administered by Police Chief Dale Coleman. “Law Enforcement is an honorable career, but can be a challenging one as well,” said Chief Coleman. “I look forward to watching them both grow and develop in their roles. Our officers support one another, and they are joining a strong team.” Christopher St. John is originally from New Jersey, but has lived in Oviedo for 30 years. He was with the Orlando Police Department for 23 years before retiring. He wanted to work for the Oviedo Police Department and come back to policing to serve the community where he lives. His son Justin, who is also looking at a potential career in law enforcement, pinned St. John after he was sworn in. William Riddleberger grew up in North Carolina and after high school, he joined the Marines. He was stationed at Camp Pendleton in California, where he served for four years, before coming to Central Florida. He went through the Oviedo Police sponsorship program and was pinned by his wife, Grace. They both enjoy spending time off at Disney. The ceremony was attended by family, friends, fellow officers, command staff, and city employees, all there to celebrate and welcome the new officers. ### 7-21 Riverside Ribbon Cutting and Open House City of Oviedo Announces Ribbon Cutting for Riverside Recreation Center Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo is proud to announce the official ribbon cutting and reopening of the Riverside Recreation Center at Riverside Park on Thursday, July 31, 2025, at 11 a.m. An open house will follow until 1 p.m. The community is invited to tour the newly rebuilt facility, meet staff and instructors, preview upcoming programs, visit vendor booths, enjoy refreshments, and enter a raffle for a free membership. Staff will also be collecting ideas for future programming for seniors. The ribbon cutting commemorates the restoration of the center after Hurricane Ian heavily damaged it in September 2022. The facility sustained up to two feet of flood damage along with interior and exterior storm damage and required a complete rebuild. Renovations included the reconstruction of racquetball courts, new floors and walls throughout, updated air conditioning units, and restroom and office renovations. Construction was completed in April 2025, allowing staff to refresh, create and expand programs for children, adults, and seniors. “This has been a long time coming, and we are thrilled to reopen this space for our community, especially for our seniors,” said Paul Belden, Oviedo Recreation and Parks Director. “We’ve heard over and over how much people missed coming here. We’re excited to welcome them back for all the amazing classes and programs they love.” Members of the media are invited to attend. Interviews and b-roll opportunities will be available during the event. When : Thursday, July 31, 2025 Time: 11 a.m. Where : Riverside Park, 1600 Lockwood Blvd., Oviedo ### 7-25 Oviedo Firefighter Promotion and Pinning FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: July 25, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald City of Oviedo Communications Manager 407-971-5509 Office 689-710-4568 Cell lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net Oviedo Fire Department Promotes Two Firefighters Oviedo, Fla. – The Oviedo Fire Department proudly announces the promotions of two firefighters to Engineer and Lieutenant. On Friday, July 25, 2025, Oviedo Fire Chief Michael Woodward held an official pinning ceremony for Michael Radzak, who was promoted to Lieutenant and Tim Deppen, who was promoted to Engineer. Lt. Radzak has been with the department for 11 years and has earned his certifications as Fire Officer I and II, Live Fire Instructor and has an Associate’s Degree in Emergency Medical Services. Eng. Tim Deppen has been a firefighter for 21 years and in 2007 was recognized as Firefighter of the Year for his involvement immediately after a fatal plane crashed in a Sanford neighborhood. Deppen has been with Oviedo Fire Department since 2004 and helped plan the pre-fire plan program in the City. “I am so proud of both of these firefighters,” said Fire Chief Michael Woodward. “Both have stepped up for the Department and the crews they work with, working hard to earn these promotions. They are well deserved.” The official pinning ceremony was held on Friday, July 25, 2025, at Fire Station 46. Fire Chief Michael Woodward presided over the event, which was attended by fellow firefighters, command staff, and family members. 7-31 Riverside Ribbon Cutting Press Release (after event) FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: July 21,2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald City of Oviedo Communications Manager 407-971-5509 Office 689-710-4568 Cell lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net City of Oviedo Ribbon Cutting for Riverside Recreation Center Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo held the official ribbon cutting and reopening of the Riverside Recreation Center at Riverside Park on Thursday, July 31, 2025, at 11 a.m. There was an open house following the ribbon cutting. A large crowd came out to see the newly rebuilt facility, meet staff and instructors, preview upcoming programs, visit vendor booths, enjoy refreshments, and enter a raffle for a free membership. Staff was also talking to residents about the types of programs they would like to see and give tours. The ribbon cutting commemorated the restoration of the center after Hurricane Ian heavily damaged it in September 2022. The facility sustained up to two feet of flood damage along with interior and exterior storm damage and required a complete rebuild. Renovations included the reconstruction of racquetball courts, new floors and walls throughout, updated air conditioning units, and restroom and office renovations. Construction was completed in April 2025, allowing staff to refresh, create and expand programs for children, adults, and seniors. “This journey started back in 2017 and our goal was to bring senior activities to Oviedo,” said Paul Belden, Oviedo Recreation and Parks Director. “Hurricane Ian brought devastating flooding to the recreation center, but we’ve spent the last several years rebuilding and renovating to reopen the recreation center.” After the ribbon cutting seniors enjoyed visiting vendor booths, eating pizza and snacks and enjoyed seeing what the facility now offers to the community. ### 8-1 Purple Heart Shadowbox Presentation FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: August 1, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald City of Oviedo Communications Manager 407-971-5509 Office 689-710-4568 Cell lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net City of Oviedo to Receive a Commemorative Purple Heart Shadowbox in Honor of National Purple Heart Day Oviedo, Fla. – On August 4, 2025, The Oviedo City Council will hold a ceremonial presentation to formally accept a Commemorative Purple Heart shadowbox from the Military Order of the Purple Heart Chapter 400. Oviedo citizen Tim Hendrix was given the Purple Heart Medal by Ed Wiles, a combat wounded veteran and acquaintance. Hendrix’s sister, Melodye Flanagan wanted to preserve the memory of the medal, so she reached out to (Ret.) U.S. Navy Captain Richard Sloane, who was also a Vietnam War Purple Heart recipient. Mr. Sloane suggested donating the shadowbox to the City of Oviedo, adding it to the Purple Heart City plaque already on display at City Hall. The shadowbox contains a Purple Heart medal and will be displayed at Oviedo City Hall to honor the bravery and sacrifice of those wounded or killed in combat while serving in the U.S. Armed Forces. “Being presented with the Purple Heart to preserve it for posterity is a great honor,” said Oviedo Mayor Megan Sladek. “The upcoming presentation reinforces Oviedo’s commitment to supporting its veteran community.” In 2018, the Oviedo City Council proclaimed Oviedo a "Purple Heart City," joining a national program recognizing communities that honor combat-wounded veterans. This ceremony also comes in advance of National Purple Heart Day, observed annually on August 7, to honor the sacrifices of America's combat-wounded service members. The ceremony will be at the August 4, 2025, City Council meeting that starts at 6:30 p.m. The ceremony is the first item on the agenda.  The Council meeting will be in the Council Chambers at City Hall, 400 Alexandria Blvd., Oviedo. Media is invited to attend the ceremony. Please contact Communications Manager Lisa McDonald at lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net or text/call 689-710-4568 before the ceremony if you plan on sending a news crew. 7-30 Switch Together Solar United Neighbors Contact Contact: Mia Brady Phone: (202) 888-3601 x 624 Email: flteam@solarunitedneighbors.org SWITCH TOGETHER, A GROUP BUYING PROGRAM FOR SOLAR INSTALLATIONS, IS NOW AVAILABLE TO CENTRAL FLORIDA RESIDENTS Switch Together is a Successful Group Buying Program for Rooftop Solar Helping Residents Learn About and Save on Solar Installations, Battery Storage, and Electric Vehicle Chargers [FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE] OVEIDO, FL - Switch Together is a group buying program for rooftop solar, battery storage, and electric vehicle chargers. The program is supported by a partnership between national nonprofit Solar United Neighbors and local governments, including multiple cities and counties throughout the United States. Switch Together makes rooftop solar installations more affordable, while also offering solar education through online resources and in-person events. The most recent auction secured an average discount of $6,421 . To date, 12,621 households have accepted an offer from Switch Together. “The Switch Together program is an incredible opportunity to go solar with your neighbors, especially in the summer when energy bills are the highest,” said Mia Brady of Solar United Neighbors. “Going solar through this program helps reduce your energy bills, and SUN provides educational support along the way.” How Does it Work? The program organizes a reverse auction with qualified installers who compete to offer their most competitive prices. This ensures participants receive a discount on a high-quality solar installation. In addition to the group discount, residents may qualify for the 30% federal tax credit. New legislation sets a deadline to claim a 30% solar tax credit. Only expenditures made by December 31, 2025 will be eligible under the new law — act this year to secure your tax savings. The Switch Together program provides an excellent opportunity for residents to take advantage of these benefits before the deadline. How to Participate Visit Switchtogether.com/en/solar/oviedo/home to register or learn more. The final day to register and accept a personal recommendation is Wednesday, September 3, 2025. Participants will receive a free personal recommendation upon registering. It is free to register. There is no obligation to accept an offer. 8-19 Relay For Life Check Donations FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: August 19, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald City of Oviedo Communications Manager 407-971-5509 Office 689-710-4568 Cell lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net City of Oviedo Donates Checks to American Cancer Society and Relay For Life Oviedo, Fla. - At the Monday, August 18, 2025, City Council Meeting, councilmembers presented ceremonial checks to the American Cancer Society and Helpful Hands, Inc. The donations come as a result from the funds raised during the Relay for Life & Helpful Hands Annual Golf Tournament held on February 21, 2025 at the Twin Rivers Golf Course. During the ceremony, the city also expressed appreciation to Waste Pro of Florida, Inc as the title sponsor and for their generous contribution to the Relay for Life & Helpful Hands Golf Tournament. City Staff has worked with Relay for Life to raise funds for the American Cancer Society for over the past sixteen (16) years and have recently introduced Helpful Hands, Inc. as a benefactor.  At the meeting, the American Cancer Society was presented with a check for $20,000 and $10,000 will be given to Helpful  Hands, Inc. According to the American Cancer Society, the nationwide estimation of cancer deaths is 618,120 annually. The American Cancer Society is trying to lower this number by raising money to fund research and support programs for cancer patients. One of the American Cancer Society’s larger fundraising events is Relay for Life, in which the City of Oviedo actively participates. Helpful Hands, Inc, is a charitable foundation founded in 2009 that provides opportunities for children to participate in educational, cultural, athletic, and community enrichment activities after critical needs are met by other agencies. Helpful Hands, Inc. provides grant funding to community partners that are identified as having the capacity to provide quality of life programs to children and families. The 16th Annual Relay for Life & Helpful Hands Golf Tournament was held on Friday, February 21, 2025, at the Twin Rivers Golf Course. The golf outing agenda included 18 holes of golf (scramble format), team photos, door prizes, and an array of food provided throughout the day by many local businesses. Prizes were given for first place and a humor award for last place. Additionally, individual prizes were given for longest drive and closest to the pin. The winning team posted a score of 50 (22 under par). Waste Pro of Florida, Inc.  was the Title sponsor for the golf outing with a contribution of $10,000. A total of $30,000 was raised from the event. ### 8-27 Labor Day Offices Closed FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: August 27, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net City Offices Closed to observe Labor Day Oviedo, Fla. – City of Oviedo government offices will be closed on Monday, September 1, 2025, to observe Labor Day.  Offices will re-open Tuesday, September 2, at 8 a.m. ### 9-5 Oktoberfest FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: September 5, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald, Communications Manager City of Oviedo 407-971-5509 lmcdonald@CityofOviedo.net Oktoberfest returns to Center Lake Park in Oviedo Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo is proud to host the annual Oktoberfest at Center Lake Park, September 25-27, 2025. It’s time to put on the Lederhosen and your best German attire, and attend the annual Oktoberfest at the Center Lake Park Amphitheatre and Cultural Center for a free three-day German-themed celebration. This year’s event will be held Thursday, September 25 – Saturday September 27 and will feature live music, authentic German beer, dancing, and authentic German food from various Food Trucks for everyone to enjoy. The event is free to attend but to grab a beer under the tent, a beer punch card must be purchased on Eventbrite.com and the purchaser must be 21 and over. Entertainment includes the Orlando Trachtenverein Dancers, and The Kings Guys Oktoberfest Brass Band. There will be plenty of things for the kids to do including face painting, juggling, stilt walkers, coloring pages and a photo booth.  There will also be contests for event-goers. What: Oktoberfest When: Thursday, September 25 th , 5 p.m. – 9 p.m., Friday, September 26 th, 5 p.m. - 9 p.m., Saturday, September 27 th, 4 p.m. – 10 p.m. Where: Center Lake Park – 299 Center Lake Lane, Oviedo Cost: Free to attend – Must purchase a Beer Punch Card on Eventbrite.com The City of Oviedo's Oktoberfest is a FREE festival made possible by A Budget Tree Service , Waste Pro , Oviedo Medical Center , Bath Fitter , The Strand , Pat’s Liquor Leaf and Wine, Mainstreet Community Bank, Progressive Distribution, and Realtors Scott Garrison and Diana Sacoto ReMax of Town & Country Realty. Media is welcome to attend any of the above-listed days/times.   For more information, please contact Communications Manager Lisa McDonald at 689-710-4568 (text or call) or email lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net . 9-8 Water Conservation Expo FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: September 8, 2025 CONTACT: Lisa McDonald City of Oviedo Communications Manager 407-971-5509 Office 689-710-4568 Cell lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net City of Oviedo and St. John’s River Water Management District to hold Water Conservation Expo for City HOAs Oviedo, Fla. – The City of Oviedo, in partnership with the St. John’s Water Management District will host an informative and educational Water Conservation Expo for residents and homeowners’ associations. The Expo will be held on Wednesday, September 10, 2025, from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. at the Oviedo Cultural Center, 357 Center Lake Lane, Oviedo. The event will feature guest speakers, presentations; and a panel discussion with interactive Q&A along with vendor booths that will have practical water-saving tips and resources to help residents easily put them into practice at home. “This is an important discussion for every resident in Oviedo,” said Oviedo City Mayor Megan Sladek. “We want to educate residents and HOAs who are using a lot of potable water to water their lawns. Our goal is to preserve the aquifer for generations.” The District is excited to partner with the City of Oviedo to share valuable water conservation information with residents and homeowners’ associations,” said St. John’s River Water Management District’s Water Conservation Coordinator, Deirdre Irwin.” We can all play a role in protecting our water resources. Speakers include: Jay Stainer - aka Mr. Aqua Man - Water Conservation Coordinator for the City of Oviedo Deirdre Irwin - Water Conservation Coordinator at the St. Johns River Water Management District Dr. Heather Kalaman - Florida-Friendly Landscaping™ Horticulture Agent for UF/IFAS Extension Orange County Claire Mitchell - Florida-Friendly Landscaping™ Statewide Education Manager Claire Mitchell serves as the Education Manager for the Florida-Friendly Landscaping™ (FFL) The Water Conservation Expo is free and open to Oviedo residents, HOA board members, and HOA management companies looking to learn about effective ways to conserve water. Media is welcome to attend. There will be b-roll and interview opportunities at the event. For more information, please contact Communications Manager, Lisa McDonald at lmcdonald@cityofoviedo.net or text 689-710-4568. ### Public Notices Agendas & Minutes Employment City Special Events

Solary Park Solary Park 239 Geneva Drive Oviedo FL 32765 Hours of Operation - Open Daily Amenities: ADA Accesibility Benches Bicycle Fix-It Station Boardwalk Chairs Parking Patio Pavilion Restrooms Walking Path Water Park is NOT available to rent. Solary Park is located in the Oviedo Historic Downtown Area at the corner of Franklin Street and Geneva Drive.  The Park provides amenities, boardwalks, rain gardens, littoral zones, and Florida-Friendly Landscaping TM .  It also provides direct access to the Florida National Scenic Trail, better known as the Florida Trail. Display boards are located throughout the Park that provide educational information on the environmental benefits of conservation areas, watersheds, and the benefits of preserving natural floodplains. See slideshow for more info. Solary Park includes an enhanced stormwater management system allowing development of the historic commercial district by allowing local business owners to utilize capacity to convey and treat the drainage from their properties via the stormwater management system. The project is essential to facilitate and provide incentive for development and redevelopment in the Historic Downtown Area. Solary Park 239 Geneva Drive Oviedo, FL 32765 Solary Park Parking Lot 161 E. Franklin Street Oviedo, FL 32765 Learn more about Solary Park below! VEGETATION AT SOLARY PARK Some of the native plantings used in Solary Park are American Beautyberry (this is the logo on Oviedo on the Park signage) Fire Bush Virginia Sweetspire Sand Cordgrass Pink Muhly Pickerel Weed Blu Flag Iris Yellow Canna Dwarf Walters Viburnum Jointed Spikerush Slash Pine Florida Flame Red Maple Sweet Bay Magnolia NATIVES OF FLORIDA These plants have naturally thrived the hot wet summers and the cool dry winters in Florida for thousands of years. Sandy soils suit them perfectly and insects and animals keep them in balance so they do not overrun spaces. When you plant native plants you are helping to balance the food web of nature, birds, butterflies, and bees all help the ecosystem to thrive. Ecosystems that thrive provide us with greater recreational and educational opportunities, cleaner water bodies, and a more transparent carbon footprint. Native plants do not require excessive watering or feeding. If you have reclaimed water you do not need to apply fertilizer as there are sufficient nutrients in the water If you do use a fertilizer use a slow-release and take note of the restriction of use in the summer months. INVASIVE PLANTS Many people plant invasive plants in their yards without even knowing. Invasive species will grow wild and stifle other valuable native plantings. One of the most common invasive species found in our conservation areas and wetlands is the air potato vine. The air potato vine was introduced to Florida around 1905 and is one of the most aggressive vines and will quickly smother and even kill trees and plants it attaches to. Volunteers in Seminole County get together to conduct an air potato raid, where vines are hand-pulled and disposed of correctly to protect surrounding vegetation and wildlife. Visit the Florida-Friendly Landscaping  website at https://ffl.ifas.ufl.edu/ for more information. RAIN GARDENS Rain Gardens help eliminate harmful pollutants from reaching our storm systems and waterways. For more information on creating your own rain garden and for selecting the right plantings visit the Florida Friendly Landscaping TM program, an extension program of the University of Florida. For assistance in garden layout and planting ideas email mastergardener@seminolecountyfl.gov . KEEPING LITTER OUT - THE LITTORAL SHELF A littoral shelf is an area between the body of water and the banks surrounding it. When planted, it can create a nice border around the water and add to both the function and beauty of the area. Using native plantings around perimeters of ponds in a littoral shelf forms a barrier of protection for the water, reduces surface litter, provides shelter and food for wildlife and birds, and helps stop erosion from occurring. Oviedo strives to balance growth with environmental harmony. This is achieved by higher regulatory codes such as native tree planting requirements, strict setback rules, and floodplain management. The purchasing of land for open space is a reflection of the City’s commitment. There are currently 2,950 acres of conservation, wetlands, and open space in the city. Remember: All city drains lead to surface waters, ditches, or lakes Anything other than rain entering the system will create pollution. To report illicit dumping please contact the Public Works Department at (407) 971-5682. THANK YOU FOR PROTECTING OUR WATERWAYS!
